title: Data Visualization-Based Thermodynamics Concept Exploration Project

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic physics concepts (energy, force, motion)
context.additional_context: Learners explore thermodynamics concepts using visualization tools in an environment accessible with personal devices, linking them to social phenomena (e.g., energy consumption patterns).

learning_goals: They can interpret data visualization materials explaining the first and second laws of thermodynamics with 80% accuracy.
Using virtual lab tools, they can simulate the operation of heat engines step-by-step and write result reports.
They can convert everyday thermodynamic phenomena (e.g., air conditioner operation principles) into data graphs and present them linked to social impacts.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
